datafield.subfield: Variable Energy Cyclotron Centre, 1/AF, Bidhannagar, Kolkata-, 700064, India
Homi Bhabha National Institute, Anushaktinagar, Mumbai-, 400094, India
Theoretical and experimental investigation of magnetic field related helium leak in helium vessel of a large superconducting magnet

• Helium vessel of K-500 Superconducting cyclotron (consisting of two coil viz. α and β) at Kolkata faces degradation of insulation vacuum with increasing coil current mainly due to α-coil. . • Equation proposed to fit experimental data of insulation vacuum with current. • Detail electro-magnetic stress analysis of helium vessel explains the dominance nature of α-coil on vacuum degradation . • Estimated leak size at no current based on experimental and MSLD data. • Offered a theoretical model to calculate the insulation vacuum with a known leak size and enhancement of it with stress at different current which closely follows the experimental observations.
